archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang-Carne Asada Sirloin with Charred Corn-Jalapeño Salsa, Quick Pickled Cucumber, and Brown Basmati Rice
description: Grilled gochujang-lime marinated sirloin meets a punchy corn–jalapeño salsa and sesame cucumber quick pickles, served with fluffy brown basmati rice. Built hot and from-scratch for a family feast.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups brown basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Smash and finely mince 4 cloves garlic.
Halve 2 limes; juice both and reserve.
Thinly slice 1 cucumber; place in a bowl.
Finely dice 1 red onion (divide: half for salsa, half for pickles).
Finely chop a handful of coriander (stems and leaves).
Finely chop 2 jalapenos (seed for less heat if desired).
Shuck 3 ears worth of corn kernels (or measure 3 cups corn).
Pat dry 1 kg sirloin steak; trim silver skin if needed.
Preheat outdoor grill to high (two-zone if possible). Set a stovetop pot with 3.5 cups water ready for rice.
cook_steps: Marinate steak: In a bowl mix 2 tbsp gochujang, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp canola oil, 2 minced garlic cloves, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Coat sirloin; rest 15–20 minutes at room temp.
Start rice: Bring 3.5 cups water to a boil, add rinsed brown basmati rice and 1 tsp salt. Reduce to low, cover, and simmer 30–35 minutes until tender; rest 5 minutes off heat, covered.
Quick pickles: Toss sliced cucumber with remaining red onion, 3 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp sesame seeds. Massage lightly and chill.

Char salsa base: Toss corn with 1 tbsp canola oil and a pinch of salt. Grill in a perforated tray or cast-iron pan 6–8 minutes, stirring, until charred. Cool slightly, then mix with half the red onion, jalapenos, 2 tbsp lime juice, chopped coriander, and a pinch of salt and black pepper.

Grill steak: Sear marinated sirloin over high heat 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (thickness dependent), moving to indirect heat to finish if needed. Rest 8–10 minutes, then slice against the grain into thin strips.
Finish rice: Fluff with a fork. Optional: sprinkle a pinch of sesame seeds.
Plate: Mound rice, top with sliced steak and spoon over any resting juices. Add a generous scoop of charred corn–jalapeño salsa and a side of sesame cucumber pickles.
Serve: Lime wedges optional (use remaining lime juice to drizzle if preferred) and extra chopped coriander.
